questions: Temperature is defined as the ratio of potential energy to the Boltzmann constant.
Internal Energy can be calculated by multiplying Temperature with Boltzmann constant.
Conductors are characterized by a moderate electrical conductivity.
Latent Heat (L) can be calculated as the amount of heat per mole of substance.
Explain why Thermodynamics is the study of the relationships between heat, temperature, and energy?
The enthalpy (H) is defined as the heat change at constant pressure.
